p: In Asia, there have been only limited studies of possible ZIKV vectors [ 87, 88] despite the widespread but benign circulation of ZIKV in people for decades [ 89]. Marchette et al. [ 90] investigated potential sylvatic mosquito vectors across Malaysia and despite analysing 27,636 Aedes spp. mosquitoes from rural areas, rain forests, mangrove swamps and freshwater swamps, they only managed to isolate ZIKV from urban Ae. aegypti. Interestingly, the authors state “there is strong serological evidence that it (ZIKV) occurs naturally in wild monkeys in Malaysia (our unpublished data)”.
